sections.content: What are habilitative services?Health care services that help a person learn or improve a functional skill that should be present but isn’t because of sickness or injury. Services must be given by a doctor or a licensed therapist. Want more information? View the glossary for definitions.

Inpatient The amount you pay is based on where the covered health service is provided. Isprior authorization needed? No Outpatient UHC Network 20%co-insurance After you pay the deductible. Isprior authorization needed? No
sections.header: Your cost if you use Network benefits

sections.content:
Inpatient The amount you pay is based on where the covered health service is provided. Isprior authorization needed? Yes When do I need to call?
  • 5 business days before a scheduled admission
  • 24 hours before a scheduled inpatient admission
50%co-insurance, however the reduction in benefits will not exceed $500if you don't get prior authorization Outpatient 40%co-insurance After you pay the deductible. Isprior authorization needed? No
sections.header: Your cost if you use Out-of-Network benefits

sections.content: Inpatient: Limited to 60DaysPer Calendar Yearcombined with Skilled Nursing Facility/Inpatient Rehabilitation Services. Outpatient: Limited to 20VisitsPer Calendar Yearcombined with Rehabilitation Services – Outpatient Physical Therapy. Visits for physical therapy do not apply to the treatment of autism or early childhood intervention. If the service is provided in a doctor’s office, additional co-pays, deductible or co-insurance may apply.
